Last week, Mr. Splichal, Superintendent of Schools, and Shanda Hurla, Executive Director of the Eudora Schools Foundation, went on a “prize patrol.” They surprised Elizabeth Schmidt, Elementary Teacher of the Year, MaryJo Swann, Secondary Teacher of the Year, and Holly Kracl, Classified Employee of the Year with their ESF prizes.

Congratulations, Class of 2020!

Andrea Pyle began her career with Eudora Schools in August of 2006 as a Health Careers Sciences Program Assistant at Eudora DeSoto Technical Education Center. She transitioned into the Health Careers Instructor in August of 2008. In addition to this role, Mrs. Pyle was also a 9-12 Building Mentor. Mrs. Pyle has served Eudora Schools for almost 14 years.

Ron Abel says, “I would just like to thank Andrea for her years of dedicated service to our school and the community. She has taken a good CTE pathway program and made it a shining example for other programs to emulate. Andrea has given everything she has to her teaching career, and a principal couldn't possibly want more than what Andrea has offered to her job. Andrea, you will surely be missed, and the EHS/EDTEC Team will miss all of your support and contributions. All the best as you enter the world of being a grandparent. Take care.”

Please join us as we congratulate Andrea Pyle on her retirement!

Mark Katzenmeier began his career with Eudora Schools in August of 1989, teaching 4th grade. In August of 2002, Mark transitioned to the gym, teaching Elementary Physical Education. In addition to his role as an Elementary PE teacher, Mark has been a 9-12 Assistant Football coach, 7-8 Assistant track coach, and K-5 building mentor. Mark has served Eudora students for 31 years.

Susan Tinich says, “Mark creates an environment that stresses movement from the moment the student walks into the gym until they leave. He teaches students various kinesthetic techniques that can be utilized throughout life for a healthy lifestyle. Mark is a storyteller and can connect with a variety of people based on his experiences and sharing those stories.”

Seth Heide says, “Mark was always fun to work with as a colleague and worked hard to challenge kids and make PE fun for them.”

Please join us as we congratulate Mark Katzenmeier on his retirement.

Deanna Brown began her career with Eudora Schools in August of 2007, as a middle school Student Counselor. In August of 2017, she transferred to Eudora High School to serve as a Guidance Counselor. In addition to her role as a school counselor, Deanna has sponsored the Eudora Middle School Student Council. In total, Deanna has served the students, families, and staff in Eudora for 13 years.

EHS Principal, Ron Abel says, “Deanna Brown is a dedicated and caring counselor. She makes herself available to students to help manage all aspects of school life. This includes their social/emotional well-being, their academic progress, and their post-secondary plans. She has been instrumental in getting our senior students to apply, pursue, and be awarded scholarships. She is tireless and accessible and makes students feel they have the capacity to achieve great things. Her presence in the EHS Office will be missed greatly, but at least I don't have to worry about getting up so early to beat her to work.”

Please join us as we congratulate Deanna Brown on her retirement!

Congratulations to Eudora Middle School 6th grade science teacher, Katie Hammerschmidt, on her recognition as the March Teacher of the Month for Eudora Schools.

Katie Hammerschmidt has served the students of Eudora Schools for 1 year, but has taught for a total of 8 years.

"Education is such a rewarding field to be in. I enjoy my coworkers who challenge me daily (and make me laugh during stressful times)," she says. "I love the students and getting to interact with them, finding out what interests them, and seeing their excitement about what we are doing in the classroom. My favorite days are when my classroom is noisy and full of activity while students work on STEM Challenges, research, and projects."

Katie and her husband, Dain, have four children, Kale (9th grade), Bailey (6th grade), Shay (4th grade), and Hadley (preschool). Katie is the daughter of Larry and Barbara Ballard of Hutchinson, KS.

Please join us as we congratulate Katie Hammerschmidt!

Special thanks to the Eudora Chamber of Commerce for sponsoring the Eudora Schools Teacher of the Month program!

EHS freshman, Kenny Brooks, recently completed his Eagle Scout Project at the high school and the West Resource Center. The project was a flag retirement box. The community can place flags that are worn out or have holes in the boxes at these locations. Boy Scout Troop 0064 will retire them respectfully and correctly. Boy Scouts of America (BSA) is one of the few organizations that the U.S. government has given permission to retire flags.

Kenney wanted to complete this project to provide our community with an easy and appropriate process for those who want to dispose of old flags. His second goal was to educate people on how to respectfully retire U.S. flags as they show signs of wear. In addition, he has had family members serve in the U.S. Armed Forces, including his Great Grandfather. This project is a way to honor those family members as well as all military past, present, and future.

Thank you Kenny!

#EudoraProud

It's 1961, and ordinary teenager Jane Doe, played by our lead female M'Cheila Rader, is drafted by the CIA to become a super-secret secret agent. Her mission? Infiltrate an American high school to locate a Russian spy about to send classified space program information to the USSR. But it's not easy being undercover, especially when your spy family consists of a femme fatale "mom" (Natalie Karten), a 40-year-old "younger brother," (Zeke Reazin) and the most dashingly narcissistic "dad" ever played by Caleb Reazin. Add that to obnoxious fellow students, a blatantly sexist curriculum, and the horror that is prom, and you've got a mission that might be impossible.

Come out and watch M'Cheila and our wonderful cast of 27 amazing actors and actresses put on a great comedy! The performance will take place in the PAC at Eudora High School on February 20, 2020, at 7:00 pm and February 22, 2020, at 7:00 pm. Tickets are $5 for adults and $4 for students K-12. See you there!

Mrs. Chesnut's 4th-grade class will be hosting a Wax Museum on February 11, 2020, at Eudora Elementary School.

In preparation for the Wax Museum, students were given a person to research and write a biography. At the Wax Museum, students will remain “in character” as their historical figure for the duration of the display, as parents, teachers, and other students walk around and listen to speeches.

In this assignment, students chose an influential person in Eudora History to study. Students used reading and comprehension skills to conduct research and gather information about their person in class over the course of three weeks. When finished with their papers, students wrote, practiced, and memorized a speech to perform at the final “Wax Museum."

We hope you can join us!

Congratulations to Sloan Hayden on his selection to represent the East side of Kansas in the 2020 Shrine Bowl! This is a significant honor as only 32 athletes from 1A-6A are selected. All-State honors are chosen by class. There are 132 first-team All-State winners across all classes and only 64 Shrine Bowl participants. The Shrine Bowl coaches were only allowed to select two athletes from 4A, and Sloan was one of them. The rest of the roster is selected by the media. The game is scheduled for July 18, 2020, in Topeka.

There have only been 6 Shrine Bowl Participants in the history of Eudora High School.

Sloan Hayden- 2020
Grant Elston- 2016
Nick Becker- 2013
Greg Snell- 2012
Morgan Abel- 2008
Andrew Pyle- 2003

Congratulations to Eudora Chamber of Commerce Teacher of the Month, Lynae Soderholm!

Ms. Soderholm is a Kindergarten teacher at Eudora Elementary School. She has taught for 4 years, all in Eudora.

She is involved in the Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports Committee, Building Leadership Team, and Multi-Tiered System of Supports - A.

"The most rewarding thing about being an educator for me is seeing my students open up, knowing they're in a safe place," she said. "Building my classroom culture has been challenging, but so rewarding when they become a family."

Ms. Soderholm completed her Masters of Education in October and plans to begin Nation Board Certification within the next few years.

Ms. Soderholm and her boyfriend, Jordan, live in Lawrence with their two pups. Lynae is the daughter of Rich and Lisa Soderholm of Alma, NE.

Well done, Ms. Solderholm!

Special thanks to the Eudora Chamber of Commerce for sponsoring the Eudora Schools Teacher of the Month program!

The sixth graders in Mrs. Hammerschmidt’s science class began their study of geology and processes that shape Earth's surface. Recently they studied mechanical weathering with a little help from chalk and bags of salt. With a little patience and a whole lot of shaking, they created chalk sediment and were able to observe the effects of mechanical weathering.

These hands-on learning experiences make learning meaningful and fun.
